text: Functional Capital should ensure workers aren't pilfering enough production surplus to get fat, actually. ...
... Your argument is with Karl and his guys. Deal with it.
Any part of the industrial surplus that doesn't end up re-invested in robotics revolution just causes social disorders in one dimension or another.
... Keeping the proletariat lean and mean was Capital's one fucking job.

... You're a Renaissance financier-magus, and the summoned spirit says: "Take the capitalist path and your people are guaranteed not to be fat homosexuals reading postcolonial fiction in their spare time." What's your trust relation with The Lofty Powers looking like right now?
Read the Scripture Howard. It's not controversial.
Howie's mad that I'm a vastly stricter Marxist than he is.

... Wages (total worker remuneration) in a capitalist order should exactly cover the reproduction of labor power, and no more. Anything else is some kind of bizarre degeneracy so unexpected that Saint Karl never wasted his time trying to envisage it.
The Marxist canon, meaning primarily Marx. Don't let yourself be tempted by heretical appeals to human weakness.
Capital will do.
I'd say MAGA communism, but they'd just waste it.
Buy yourself another Essential Writings of Karl Marx box set, in the original German if possible.

"One fat prole is a complete refutation of Marxism actually."
"So you're saying the libertarians won via McDonalds?"
"Fuck no, I still want Marx to be right."

... "Spare time? What is this gay shit?"
Yes, exactly.
So no elevator pitch from you, I'm assuming?
So true.
